document_title: Lupus nephritis: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis, prevention
subsection_content:
Symptoms of lupus nephritis are similar to other kidney diseases, specifically: (2)
Dark urine; Foaming or blood in urine; Increased need to urinate, especially at night; Weight gain.; High Blood Pressure.
Symptoms of the disease do not appear often and tend to be intermittent. Therefore, kidney damage is often detected through urine test results.
However, people with systemic lupus erythematosus should note: Not all problems in the urinary system are signs of lupus nephritis. Some cases may be a sign of a urinary tract infection.
